title: Job Remembers His Former Glory
summary: Job nostalgically recalls the days when he was respected, prosperous, and close to God. He was a helper of the poor, a father to the needy, and a judge who upheld justice.

faq.question: What kind of man was Job before his suffering?
faq.answer: A just, generous, and honored leader in his community.

faq.question: Why does Job reflect on the past?
faq.answer: To highlight how much he has lost and how confusing his suffering feels.
